Output of `helm version`:
```
version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.0.0-alpha.1", GitCommit:"b9a54967f838723fe241172a6b94d18caf8bcdca", GitTreeState:"clean"}
```

Output of `kubectl version`:
```
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"14", GitVersion:"v1.14.1", GitCommit:"b7394102d6ef778017f2ca4046abbaa23b88c290", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-04-08T17:11:31Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.1", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"darwin/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"14", GitVersion:"v1.14.1+IKS", GitCommit:"7212ba91727da63ce9cfb2b5eba7f988f0f125d0", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-05-09T14:28:29Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.1", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```
Cloud Provider/Platform (AKS, GKE, Minikube etc.): 
IBM Cloud (IKS)


I have a helm 2 chart that includes another chart by this content in requirements.yaml
```
dependencies:
  - name: cp-helm-charts
    version: 0.1.0
    repository: https://confluentinc.github.io/cp-helm-charts/
    condition: kafka.internal.enabled
  - name: openldap
    version: 0.3.0
    repository: https://kubernetes-charts.storage.googleapis.com/
```

However if kafka.internal.enabled is set to false (in my case values.yaml sets it to true, but I have content in an additional file specified by '-f ~/cloud.yaml which sets it to false), the cp-helm-chart (confluent kafka) IS deployed regardless
